channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Big Tech Stocks Are Falling but That Doesn’t Mean There’s an AI Bubble
item.description: The stock selloff doesn’t justify claims of another internet bubble.

item.title: Corcoran Group CEO says Gen Z and millionaires alike are flocking back to the city—but return-to-office mandates aren’t the main reason
item.description: CEO of one of the nation’s largest realtors says New York’s gravitational pull is back—but it’s career insurance, not RTO, driving people to return.

item.title: Emotionally intelligent people use 5 short phrases to strengthen relationships
item.description: How do I control my emotions? I get asked that question a lot. As an emotional intelligence coach, I’ve received thousands of emails from readers over...

item.title: Markets are plunging worldwide after ‘Big Short’ investor Michael Burry reveals $1.1 billion bet against AI stocks
item.description: Wall Street expects tech stocks to take a hammering this morning—again.

item.title: Former FBI special agent says he used a simple trick to get the best hotel rooms in the world—and it’s all about showing love to the front desk
item.description: According to licensed private investigator Tom Simon, "I've been doing this for 20 years and the rooms I get are majestic, man."

item.title: A Ton of Data Suggests People Are Getting Less Weird. Should We Worry?
item.description: A psychologist says our culture is growing more risk averse and less weird. Can entrepreneurs help us escape the blandness?

item.title: AI hardware is reinventing the humble dictaphone
item.description: From my earliest days as a journalist, I’ve always prized my dictaphone. It sounds quaint now, but I actually remember excitedly keeping up with advan...

item.title: AI is going to be a game changer for Black Friday
item.description: Black Friday isn’t what it once was. Less than 15 years ago, it was fairly common for people to wake up at ridiculously early hours to drive to a stor...

item.title: Ulta Beauty CEO Kecia Steelman went from earning $8 an hour to running the U.S.’s largest beauty retailer
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Champion of Dollar Slices and Rent Freezes: Small Businesses React To Mamdani Win in NYC Mayoral Race
item.description: Mamdani wants to bring back the dollar slice, expedite small business permitting and boost small business funding by some 500 percent. Are business ow...

item.title: Meet OpenAI’s master builder: Greg Brockman is steering a $1.4 trillion infrastructure surge with stakes that go far beyond AI
item.description: As OpenAI's president, Brockman is steamrolling toward "completing the mission" of moving beyond AI to artificial general intelligence (AGI).

item.title: What Mikie Sherrill’s Victory in New Jersey Means for Businesses
item.description: Here’s where New Jersey’s governor-elect stands on four key issues that affect businesses.

item.title: An AI coach in every cubicle
item.description: Some companies see leadership and managerial training as an investment. Others, however, provide very few resources for the transition from individual...

item.title: Concerned You Don’t Spend Enough Time With Your Kids? Science Says Quality Beats Quantity
item.description: If you want to raise emotionally healthy kids, research shows how–not how long–you spend time with them matters more.

item.title: Are you trapped in the middle as a middle manager?
item.description: I spent several years of my career in the uncomfortable role of middle manager. On one side, I had executives asking me why my team couldn’t “do more,...
